title: best examples to show just how empty DC is?
text:
hey. i run two photography pages on Instagram, and i also got a new camera i would like to test out so i figured out my next subject matter would be showcasing how just the contrast b/t a "dynamic" DC and one that's near standstill.

i know this may not be a great idea given the fact we're in the midst of a worldwide pandemic. but i can 1000% promise with a cherry on top that i'll follow social distancing, wear a mask, and use gloves (and properly dispose of them), and since i'll be walking around (and maybe using Metro), it could be considered recreation (?)

i wanted to know what locations in the area that are usually busy and teaming with life are empty and desolate. locations such as streets, neighborhoods, attractions, etc.

i also had a question about getting lunch because i know most places are closed for dining in, but i was wondering if i could do takeout and have a little fun picnic by myself in Farragut Sq or something haha

i was also wondering if i would get any shit from law enforcement if they saw some dorky kid with two cameras walking around in the midst of a pandemic.

again, sorry if this generally isn't a good idea, it just seems almost something in a lifetime opportunity.
